thread.title: H.S. field hockey: No. Highlands, Ramsey advance in BCT - Field Hockey
thread.title_full: H.S. field hockey: No. Highlands, Ramsey advance in BCT - Field Hockey - NorthJersey.com

author: SPECIAL TO THE RECORD |
title: H.S. field hockey: No. Highlands, Ramsey advance in BCT - Field Hockey
text:
Sunday’s Bergen County field hockey tournament semifinals in Oradell produced a marquee matchup for the final. With second-seed Northern Highlands defeating third-seed Westwood, 3-0, and top-seed Ramsey topping fourth-seed NV/Old Tappan, 2-0, two of the county’s best teams will face off for the crown on Oct. 25.
Northern Highlands (12-2-1) broke a scoreless tie against Westwood (4-9-3) on a Chelsea Quinn goal in the 39th minute. The Highlanders added a pair of goals and an assist from Gabby Pontone.
"We preached patience throughout the game, [to] be patient and your opportunity will come [and] stay within yourself," said Northern Highlands coach Rich Smith. "We [persevered] and the players were rewarded for it."
Ramsey (16-0) earned its 11th shutout of the season. The Rams last allowed a goal on Oct. 8 vs. Pompton.
Ramsey goals were scored by Kassidy Shetler, who notched her 30th of the season in the second half, and Mary Pless, who tallied her seventh.
The Rams finished with an 18-1 advantage in shots on goal.
— Dave Meisel
Tennis 
The fifth-seeded Holy Angles tennis team was eliminated from the NJSIAA Tournament of Champions after a 3-2 quarterfinal-round loss to No. 4 Montgomery at Garden State Tennis Center in Edison on Sunday.
Holy Angels’ points came from first- and second-singles players Ashley Hess and Adrianne Alfonso. Hess, a freshman, topped Lily Chu, 6-1, 6-0, while Alfonso, a senior, beat Shannon Lu, 6-1, 6-2.
— Bob Shwalb
